I watch all kinds of films. Good or bad. As someone interested in film I get a "take away" from every film I watch. There is a lot to learn here if you are an indie film maker. The two keys that will turn off the audience is the acting and the sound. Without those elements people will turn it off. I did watch it all the way through because I do that with any film. I believe casting was good for the most part however, there needed to be more time with these actors to light up these characters. Like the CI in the car... Great actor, but man he could have been a little more animated with proper direction and that would have sparked that scene. I love crime and drama. I have written a few. I gave this film a 3 star because God bless them. They got it done and out. There is so much involved in film making... You know what they say... everyone can shoot a film... not everyone can finish it. Cheers!

I did not like this movie. I felt the acting was forced and not believable. The movie appeared amateurish with actors sounding like they were reading their lines. The plot was predictable and the main character looked like he was smiling throughout. He did not have that tough guy persona which detracted from the movie being believable. There was much action and a few surprises but it was just a bad looking and sounding movie.

This story has some serious action and some wicked twists I never saw coming. An eye for an eye can get you healed the quickest and its on display here, big time. The police work looks authentic and the acting is good. Production values are high. I would like to see a sequel which they set up at the end. Interesting dialogue and situations. Good flick. The rape scene (which always bothers me a lot) was not graphic and I could handle it, barely. Recommended.

A pretty decent, if not tired, story of revenge.  However, what really mars this movie is the crappy sound and mediocre acting.

Given a better cast, this would be pretty good.  The producer, writer and actor as well as executive producer and actor have a lot to learn about acting.  Just because one has the money to put together a film doesn't mean they need to be in it.

No, no, no, no, no. These 5 star reviews, seriously? OK, so this is a low budget independent, and there have been some absolutely great low budget independent films, but this is not one of them.

Acting: for the most part, stilted and wooden, I've seen better acting on the stage at local amateur dramatics productions, far better. Storyline: yes, nice twist at the end, but - talking of am-dram - played remarkably similarly to a stage play, with people standing around waving their arms and explaining, for our benefit in case we weren't keeping up, just what was going down. Editing: incredibly varied, at times quite acceptable, at others so slack you could drive a bus through the most un-lifelike pregnant pauses (yes, Mr Jimz, in real life people interrupt each other, all the time, just like in the movies. But not this one.) Music: some really, really strange choices. According to the credits, editing and score were down to the same person; maybe choose just one next time?

Please, Amazon, take this away, it's wasting precious lives.

Just when I believe it is getting better the screen is like an i-phone. The near ending twist was real good. It's a real shame the rest of the movie imagery was inconsistent, it had selfie video like on an i-phone.

almost every failed actor and actress is in this movie, together with failed lieutenant, psychiatrist, bartender, bouncer, narco, computer geek, script writer, director, cinematographer,  etc. The only actress is the stripper.

Bad sound, bad editing, worse graphics.  Right to left and left to right scene progressions gave me a headache, and the music amplified the mess.  It is unacceptable to produce something of this quality, when even modest improvements would have raised it to at least watchable.
